resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

nevi-me commented on a change in pull request #9123:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/9123#discussion_r553191590



##########
File path: docs/source/status.rst
##########
@@ -169,18 +170,18 @@ Notes:
 C Data Interface
 ================
 
-+-----------------------------+-------+--------+-------+
-| Feature                     | C++   | Python | R     |
-|                             |       |        |       |
-+=============================+=======+========+=======+
-| Schema export               | ✓     | ✓      | ✓     |
-+-----------------------------+-------+--------+-------+
-| Array export                | ✓     | ✓      | ✓     |
-+-----------------------------+-------+--------+-------+
-| Schema import               | ✓     | ✓      | ✓     |
-+-----------------------------+-------+--------+-------+
-| Array import                | ✓     | ✓      | ✓     |
-+-----------------------------+-------+--------+-------+
++-----------------------------+-------+--------+-------+-------+

Review comment:
       @jorgecarleitao this one's your baby ❤️, may you please populate what's supported on the C Data interface in Rust.
   Please push directly on my branch

URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/9123#discussion_r553191933



##########
File path: docs/source/status.rst
##########
@@ -161,6 +161,7 @@ Notes:
 
 * \(1) No support for handshake or DoExchange.
 * \(2) Support using AspNetCore authentication handlers.
+* \(3) Flight integration testing for Rust is still ongoing as of version 3.0.0, see ARROW-8853.

Review comment:
       @carols10cents I haven't ticked anything here, as we haven't merged the flight test PR

issuetype.description: A task that needs to be done.
issuetype.name: Task

fields.description: The [status matrix](https://github.com/apache/arrow/blob/master/docs/source/status.rst) should be updated with the latest Rust additions (for example the C data interface support).

comments.body: Does each of the ticks in "Data Types" correspond to a specific integration test passing? E.g. Rust supports LargeList, but the list does not contain it. Or is it general support without an integration test in place?
I would say general support, but if a type is supported, why isn't the corresponding integration test enabled?
[~nevi_me]I think you were working on this as part of one of your PRs? Do you think this can still be done for the release (would need to be resolve in the next few days)
